summary: The federal government owns $1 trillion in personal property, such as furniture and vehicles. Agencies can sell these items and use the proceeds to buy similar items. The General Services Administration makes the rules for these federal agency transactions, buys and sells vehicles for other agencies to use, and carries out its own transactions. We found that GSA officials who buy vehicles and Army officials...
title: Federal Personal Property: GSA and VA Have Opportunities to Improve the Exchange Sale Process
